channel.title: Mopar's Web host?
channel.description:
Hey there. I've been wondering what Mopar uses to host their site, as I'm looking for a new web host besides Hosting24, preferably with cPanel, and possibly 900GB+ bandwidth (I'm not sure how much I'll need).
Thanks.

item.title: Mopar's Web host?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Like I said he has a dedicated server to run this site.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar's Web host?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Mopar has one of his own servers that he put together himself, I think he then just rents space in a datacenter somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar's Web host?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

CoonHunter:

and more cost-efficient because you don’t need to pay for every little thing.

If the website is popular at all, you need a very fast upload speed. Depending on where you live, it could be much more exspensive to host it yourself.

For me to run a high traffic website, it would be much cheaper to rent space at a data center. The speeds needed for a site like this are not even available in my area

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar's Web host?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:10, topic:351367”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=447726.msg3288724#msg3288724 date=1280382185]

I will always say, its better to use your own computer(custom built) to fit your needs for your website, easier to get to/use imo.

No.

Yes.

It would be much slower, much less safer and more unreliable to host it by yourself. Let a professional do it for you; it costs hardly anything nowadays for a decent web host.

It is not much different than how professionals do it after you think about it. They get and/or build the computers they use, install the proper software they will need, and begin setting up. As long as you find the right internet provider to go from, you can host a successful website by yourself, and more cost-efficient because you don’t need to pay for every little thing. Only difference from professionals, is that they know exactly what to do.
[/quote]That’s why Google and Guides we’re created, am i correct?[/quote]
Guides can’t teach you what a pro knows, but they can tell you bits of information so you can get the just of it. I have never seen a guide that didn’t just scratch the surface on stuff when dealing with hosting.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar's Web host?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:350152”][quote author=`Aaron link=topic=446519.msg3279043#msg3279043 date=1279752011]

You don’t want a windows VPS, they are more expensive, leave less ram available for the servers you run, and are much less stable and can handle fewer connections (players). Get a Linux or FreeBSD VPS.

But i have a windows computer.

So what? You can administrate any VPS from a windows computer too, or you can install linux on your computer.

You don’t want a windows VPS, they are more expensive, leave less ram available for the servers you run, and are much less stable and can handle fewer connections (players). Get a Linux or FreeBSD VPS.

I was considering linux, the vps is for personal use, no private server usage of any kind.

Which Linux OS do you recommend?

I would recommend something based on debian, either debian stable, or ubuntu LTS server are great, those are what this site is running on.

I’m looking for around 2GB of ram, 50gb of disk space, etc.

Can you redirect me to a website?
[/quote]

I’ve never used a VPS, so I can’t tell you based on experience. This is the company I have a dedicated through though:
http://www.gigenetcloud.com/cloud-servers/price.html
I’ve also heard good things about these people:
http://www.linode.com/[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar's Web host?
item.dc:creator: @PvPTurf PvPTurf
item.description:
@PvPTurf wrote:

jmood128:

MITB uses a dedicated server to host the web site.

Well It’s all got to start somewhere. Who supplies their dedi? I need major stability for 100+ visitors on constantly, and 10k+ registered members, after a few months.

Read full topic
